name: If at first you don't succeed
description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

key_work.title: If at first you don’t succeed
key_work.brief_description: Since 2015, Celeste Barber’s resisted the swarm of unattainable images on social media with her #celestechallengeaccepted project, an experiment to see how normal people look recreating the perfectly staged poses of the rich and Insta-famous

constellations_primary.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_primary.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

start.title: Keeping Up with the Kardashians

video_links.name: Las Kardashian - Todos los lunes a las 22.00 en FOX Life

start.brief_description: A peek inside the exploits and privileged private lives of the blended Kardashian-Jenner family, including sisters Kim, Kourtney and Khloé.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed

constellations_other.name: Reality TV me
constellations_other.description: Cult documentary Grey Gardens follows the everyday eccentricities of mother and daughter Big Edie and Little Edie. The women perform and speak candidly to the camera, and have been described as predecessors to reality TV stars.

constellations_other.name: Raemar, rap and reality TV
constellations_other.description: James Turrell's immersive artworks have an unusual connection with Saturday Night Live, hip hop and reality TV royalty.

end.title: Sylvania Waters
end.brief_description: Sylvania Waters was an Australian reality television series that followed the lives of an Australian family – one of the first such programs in Australia.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

links.description: While Keeping Up with the Kardashians has kept up with the rich, famous and aesthetically augmented for over 13 years, Australia’s own answer to a wealthy reality-TV family premiered 15 years earlier with Sylvania Waters.

links.description: The video that Celeste Barber is parodying in her Catch of the day video is of Russian influencer Anna Kanyuk closing her car boot with her foot.

links.description: Since 2015, Celeste Barber’s resisted the swarm of air-brushed and unattainable images of the Insta-famous with her #celestechallengeaccepted project. Instagram users upload their own pics to the hashtag, which often take aim at the Kardashians.

start.title: If at first you don’t succeed

constellations_primary.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_primary.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

end.title: Euphoria
end.brief_description: A group of high school students navigate love and friendships in a world of drugs, sex, trauma, and social media.

constellations_other.name: If at first you don't succeed
constellations_other.description: Though originally intended as a laugh, Celeste Baber’s social media posts have become examples of body positivity to her eight million followers and challenge the absurd expectations put on women in society.

constellations_other.name: Unpacking: domestic intimacy and the coming-of-age film
constellations_other.description: Many screen-based narratives focus on packing up and moving house, new starts and teenage bedrooms, or are entirely shot in one room, revealing what we can learn about characters from a domestic environment.

links.description: HBO’s teen drama Euphoria could never be accused of featuring the types of perfect, athletic white teens that soaps from the past like Beverly HIlls: 90210 or The OC celebrated, with a cast that reflects society’s diverse racial and gender identities, sexualities and body types.
